Posts.Content: lynne2009 wrote: Hi all, I had an excisional biopsy yesterday.  I'm at home recovering.  The pain is not terrible right now, but that may just be because I am taking vidodin every 4 hours to try to stay ahead of the pain.  The bruising is already starting, and I am very sore. Anyhow, my doctor thinks it is a fibroademnoma, but she did say she can't say she is "100" percent until she runs the tests.  I should hear from her in a few days to make an appointment to talk results. I have read that fibroadenomas do increase the chance of breast cancer in the future.  I already know that even if it is benign, I have to continue monitoring my breasts with regular ultrasounds because yesterday my doctor found another lump starting (might just be dense breast tissue, though, b/c it is so small). I've been reading about this stuff - yup, I'm one of those that just searches for as much info I can get my paws on- and I don't feel that I meet the symptoms of a fibroadenoma.  My pain is not associated at all with my cycle, and I could never move the lump.  Hmmm.  I just don't know.  Just waiting and praying now.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: waiting for excisional biopsy results lynne2009 Kirky
